required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Phase 1 Study to Evaluate the Effect of DS-8201a on the QT/QTc Interval and Pharmacokinetics in HER2-Expressing Breast Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Phase 1, Multicenter, Open-label, Multiple-dose Study of DS-8201a to Assess the Effect on the QT Interval and Pharmacokinetics in Subjects With HER2-expressing Metastatic and/or Unresectable Breast Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: This study will look at the effect on the QTc interval and pharmacokinetics after multiple dosing in subjects with HER2-expressing metastatic and/or unresectable breast cancer.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in QTcF After Treatment With DS-8201a in Participants With HER2-expressing Metastatic and/or Unresectable Breast Cancer
primary_outcome.time_frame: Screening (within 7 days before enrollment) up to Cycle 3 Day 15 (each cycle is 21 days)
primary_outcome.description: The number of participants with notable electrocardiogram changes meeting predefined criteria is being reported.

primary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetic Parameters of Maximum Serum Concentration (Cmax) After Cycle 1 and Cycle 3 Treatments With DS-8201a in Participants With HER2-expressing Metastatic and/or Unresectable Breast Cancer
primary_outcome.time_frame: Cycles 1 and 3: Day 1: before infusion (BI), end of infusion (EOI), 2 hours, 4 hours, 7 hours; Days 2 and 4: 24 hours, 72 hours; Days 8 and 15; Cycle 2: Day 1 BI, EOI; Cycles 4, 6, and 8: Day 1 BI and EOI (each cycle is 21 days)
primary_outcome.description: Maximum serum concentration (Cmax) of DS-8201a and total anti-HER2 antibody was assessed.

primary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetic Parameters of Maximum Serum Concentration (Cmax) of MAAA-1181 After Cycle 1 and Cycle 3 Treatments With DS-8201a in Participants With HER2-expressing Metastatic and/or Unresectable Breast Cancer
primary_outcome.time_frame: Cycles 1 and 3: Day 1: before infusion (BI), end of infusion (EOI), 2 hours, 4 hours, 7 hours; Days 2 and 4: 24 hours, 72 hours; Days 8 and 15; Cycle 2: Day 1 BI, EOI; Cycles 4, 6, and 8: Day 1 BI and EOI (each cycle is 21 days)
primary_outcome.description: Maximum serum concentration (Cmax) of MAAA-1181 was assessed.

primary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetic Parameters Area Under the Concentration-Time Curve After Cycle 1 and Cycle 3 Treatments With DS-8201a in Participants With HER2-expressing Metastatic and/or Unresectable Breast Cancer
primary_outcome.time_frame: Cycles 1 and 3: Day 1: before infusion (BI), end of infusion (EOI), 2 hours, 4 hours, 7 hours; Days 2 and 4: 24 hours, 72 hours; Days 8 and 15; Cycle 2: Day 1 BI, EOI; Cycles 4, 6, and 8: Day 1 BI and EOI (each cycle is 21 days)
primary_outcome.description: Area under the concentration versus-time curve from time 0 to the last quantifiable concentration (AUClast) and during the dosing interval (AUCtau) of DS-8201a and total anti-HER2 antibody were assessed.

primary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetic Parameters Area Under the Concentration-Time Curve of MAAA-1181 After Cycle 1 and Cycle 3 Treatments With DS-8201a in Participants With HER2-expressing Metastatic and/or Unresectable Breast Cancer
primary_outcome.time_frame: Cycles 1 and 3: Day 1: before infusion (BI), end of infusion (EOI), 2 hours, 4 hours, 7 hours; Days 2 and 4: 24 hours, 72 hours; Days 8 and 15; Cycle 2: Day 1 BI, EOI; Cycles 4, 6, and 8: Day 1 BI and EOI (each cycle is 21 days)
primary_outcome.description: Area under the concentration versus-time curve from time 0 to the last quantifiable concentration (AUClast) and during the dosing interval (AUCtau) were assessed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Objective Response Rate Based on The Investigator's Assessment (Unconfirmed) Following DS-8201a Treatment in Participants With HER2-expressing Metastatic and/or Unresectable Breast Cancer
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to withdrawal of consent, progressive disease, or unacceptable toxicity (whichever occurs first), up to approximately 12 months post-dose
secondary_outcome.description: Objective response rate (ORR) was defined as unconfirmed complete response (CR) and partial response (PR) as assessed by the investigator based on Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors (RECIST) version 1.1. CR was defined as a disappearance of all target lesions and PR was defined as at least a 30% decrease in the sum of diameters of target lesions.

secondary_outcome.measure: Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events of Any Grade by Preferred Term Following DS-8201a Treatment in Participants With HER2-expressing Metastatic and/or Unresectable Breast Cancer
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to withdrawal of consent, progressive disease, or unacceptable toxicity (whichever occurs first), up to approximately 12 months post-dose
secondary_outcome.description: Adverse events (AEs) were to be coded using MedDRA Version 20.1 and assigned severity grades based on Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE) Version 4.03. A treatment-emergent adverse event (TEAE) was defined as an AE that occurred, having been absent before the first dose of study drug, or had worsened in severity or seriousness after initiating the study drug until 47 days after last dose of study drug.

arm_group.description: All participants will receive DS-8201a by intravenous infusion

intervention.description: DS-8201a is supplied as a lyophilized powder which is reconstituted for infusion

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Has a pathologically documented unresectable or metastatic breast cancer with HER2 expression (immunohistochemistry [IHC] 3+, IHC 2+, IHC 1+ and/or in situ hybridization [ISH] +) that is refractory to or intolerable with standard treatment, or for which no standard treatment is available
- Has a left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF) ≥ 50%
- Has an Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group performance status (ECOG PS) score of 0 or 1
Exclusion Criteria:
- Has a medical history of myocardial infarction within 6 months before enrollment
- Has a medical history of ventricular arrhythmias, other than rare occasional premature ventricular contractions
- Has uncontrolled or significant cardiovascular disease

facility.name: The Cancer Institute Hospital of Japanese Foundation For Cancer Research
National Hospital Organization Kyushu Cancer Center
Social Medical Corporation Hakuaikai Sagara Hospital

patient_data.ipd_description: De-identified individual participant data (IPD) and applicable supporting clinical trial documents may be available upon request at https://vivli.org/. In cases where clinical trial data and supporting documents are provided pursuant to our company policies and procedures, Daiichi Sankyo will continue to protect the privacy of our clinical trial participants. Details on data sharing criteria and the procedure for requesting access can be found at this web address: https://vivli.org/ourmember/daiichi-sankyo/
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Studies for which the medicine and indication have received European Union (EU) and United States (US), and/or Japan (JP) marketing approval on or after 01 January 2014 or by the US or EU or JP Health Authorities when regulatory submissions in all regions are not planned and after the primary study results have been accepted for publication.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: Formal request from qualified scientific and medical researchers on IPD and clinical study documents from clinical trials supporting products submitted and licensed in the United States, the European Union and/or Japan from 01 January 2014 and beyond for the purpose of conducting legitimate research. This must be consistent with the principle of safeguarding study participants' privacy and consistent with provision of informed consent.

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

participant_flow.recruitment_details: A total of 51 participants who met all inclusion criteria and no exclusion criteria were enrolled and treated at 7 sites in Japan.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: The 6.4 mg/kg DS-8201a dose was chosen for this study based on the efficacy, safety, and pharmacokinetic profiles established in an earlier Phase 1 trial.

group.title: DS-8201a
group.description: Participants who received 6.4 mg/kg of DS-8201a as an intravenous (IV) infusion once every 3 weeks (Q3W) on Day 1 of each 21-day cycle.

outcome.title: Objective Response Rate Based on The Investigator's Assessment (Unconfirmed) Following DS-8201a Treatment in Participants With HER2-expressing Metastatic and/or Unresectable Breast Cancer
outcome.description: Objective response rate (ORR) was defined as unconfirmed complete response (CR) and partial response (PR) as assessed by the investigator based on Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors (RECIST) version 1.1. CR was defined as a disappearance of all target lesions and PR was defined as at least a 30% decrease in the sum of diameters of target lesions.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to withdrawal of consent, progressive disease, or unacceptable toxicity (whichever occurs first), up to approximately 12 months post-dose
outcome.population: Response was assessed in the Efficacy Analysis Set.

group.title: HER2 Positive
group.description: Participants with HER2 positive expression (defined as immunohistochemistry 3+ or in situ hybridization positive) who received 6.4 mg/kg of DS-8201a as an intravenous (IV) infusion once every 3 weeks on Day 1 of each 21-day cycle.

group.title: HER2 Low
group.description: Participants with HER2 low expression (defined as immunohistochemistry 1+ or 2+/ in situ hybridization negative or missing) who received 6.4 mg/kg of DS-8201a as an intravenous (IV) infusion once every 3 weeks on Day 1 of each 21-day cycle.

measure.title: Objective Response Rate Based on The Investigator's Assessment (Unconfirmed) Following DS-8201a Treatment in Participants With HER2-expressing Metastatic and/or Unresectable Breast Cancer
measure.description: Objective response rate (ORR) was defined as unconfirmed complete response (CR) and partial response (PR) as assessed by the investigator based on Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors (RECIST) version 1.1. CR was defined as a disappearance of all target lesions and PR was defined as at least a 30% decrease in the sum of diameters of target lesions.
measure.population: Response was assessed in the Efficacy Analysis Set.

outcome.title: Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events of Any Grade by Preferred Term Following DS-8201a Treatment in Participants With HER2-expressing Metastatic and/or Unresectable Breast Cancer
outcome.description: Adverse events (AEs) were to be coded using MedDRA Version 20.1 and assigned severity grades based on Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE) Version 4.03. A treatment-emergent adverse event (TEAE) was defined as an AE that occurred, having been absent before the first dose of study drug, or had worsened in severity or seriousness after initiating the study drug until 47 days after last dose of study drug.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to withdrawal of consent, progressive disease, or unacceptable toxicity (whichever occurs first), up to approximately 12 months post-dose
outcome.population: Treatment-emergent adverse events (TEAEs) were assessed in the Safety Analysis Set.

group.title: DS-8201a
group.description: Participants who received 6.4 mg/kg of DS-8201a as an intravenous (IV) infusion once every 3 weeks on Day 1 of each 21-day cycle.

A treatment-emergent adverse event (TEAE) was defined as an AE that occurred, having been absent before the first dose of study drug, or had worsened in severity or seriousness after initiating the study drug until 47 days after last dose of study drug.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
